short_summary: Canadian Armed Forces, need a qualified service provider to support the provision of Hawker Beechcraft King Air 350 simulator training.
description: standing offer solicitation for vocational training services and amendment details
tags: Preferential Treatment for Canadian Goods and Services.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Title
King Air 350 Flight Training

## Solicitation Number
W6399-23LK65/C

## Tender Closing Date
14:00 EST on  September 18, 2023

## Solicitation Description
The Department of National Defence is seeking a qualified service provider with expertise in providing Hawker Beechcraft King Air 350 simulator training to Canadian Armed Forces members for operating the CE-145 aircraft. The successful contractor will be responsible for providing training resources, instructors, and personnel to support this initiative.

## Important Details
* Solicitation Type: Request for Standing Offer (RFSA)
* Bidding Method: Competitive - Open bidding
* Evaluation Criterion: Lowest Price
* Languages of Response: Both official languages of Canada (English and French)

## Contract Information
* Contract Period: Starts without a fixed end date
* Target Regions: Canada
* End User Entities: Canadian Armed Forces

## Notice and Attachments
The entire solicitation can be accessed online through Canada Buys with the following URLs:
- English: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/8699/w6399-23-lk65_c_rfso_ka350_training_eng__0.pdf
- French: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/8699/w6399-23-lk65_c_rfso_ka350_training_fra_0.pdf
The announcement also includes an amendment document that can be found here: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/8699/w6399_23_lk65_c_rfso_amd001_fr_en.pdf

## Contact Information
Inquiries about this solicitation should be directed to Christopher Muldoon:
- Email: christopher.muldoon@forces.gc.ca
- Phone: (613) 990-5234

## Trade Agreements
This solicitation is open to contractors that have agreements with the government of Canada, such as the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement and the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership.

*Canada retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.**



Let me know if you need any further clarification or any other changes!
